   <h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" lang="en">
    New York metropolitan area
   </h1>
   <div class="mw-body-content" id="bodyContent">
    <div class="noprint" id="siteSub">
     From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
    </div>
    <div id="contentSub">
    </div>
    <div class="mw-jump" id="jump-to-nav">

      navigation
     </a>

     </a>

     <div class="mw-parser-output">
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       This article is about the area surrounding
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">
        New York City
       </a>
       . For other such areas in the state, see
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_State_metropolitan_areas" title="New York State metropolitan areas">
        New York State metropolitan areas
       </a>
       .
      </div>

         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_codes_215_and_267" title="Area codes 215 and 267">
          215
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_codes_215_and_267" title="Area codes 215 and 267">
          267
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_codes_570_and_272" title="Area codes 570 and 272">
          272
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_347" title="Area code 347">
          347
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_203" title="Area code 203">
          475
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Area_codes_610_and_484" title="Area codes 610 and 484">
          484
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Area_code_516" title="Area code 516">
          516
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Area_codes_201_and_551" title="Area codes 201 and 551">
          551
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_570" title="Area code 570">
          570
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Area_code_609" title="Area code 609">
          609
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Area_codes_610_and_484" title="Area codes 610 and 484">
          610
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_631" title="Area code 631">
          631
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_646" title="Area code 646">
          646
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_718" title="Area code 718">
          718
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_732" title="Area code 732">
          732
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Area_code_845" title="Area code 845">
          845
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_848" title="Area code 848">
          848
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_860" title="Area code 860">
          860
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_862" title="Area code 862">
          862
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Area_code_908" title="Area code 908">
          908
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Area_code_914" title="Area code 914">
          914
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Area_code_917" title="Area code 917">
          917
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_929" title="Area code 929">
          929
         </a>
         ,
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Area_code_973" title="Area code 973">
          973
         </a>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;text-align:left; font-size:smaller">
         <b>
          Highest elevation
         </b>
         4,180 ft/1,274 m (
         <a href="/wiki/Slide_Mountain_(Ulster_County,_New_York)" title="Slide Mountain (Ulster County, New York)">
          Slide Mountain (Ulster County, New York)
         </a>
         , in the
         <a href="/wiki/Catskill_Mountains" title="Catskill Mountains">
          Catskill Mountains
         </a>
         ).
         <br/>
         <b>
          Lowest elevation
         </b>
         0 ft/0 m (
         <a href="/wiki/Sea_level" title="Sea level">
          sea level
         </a>
         ) at the
         <a href="/wiki/Atlantic_Ocean" title="Atlantic Ocean">
          Atlantic Ocean
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Long_Island_Sound" title="Long Island Sound">
          Long Island Sound
         </a>
         , and at
         <a href="/wiki/Hudson_River" title="Hudson River">
          Hudson River
         </a>
         <a href="/wiki/Estuary" title="Estuary">
          estuary
         </a>
         waterways.
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <p>
       The
       <b>
        New York metropolitan area
       </b>
       , also referred to as the
       <b>
        Tri-State Area
       </b>
       , includes
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">
        New York City
       </a>
       as the most populous
       <a href="/wiki/City" title="City">
        city
       </a>
       in the
       <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">
        United States
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Long_Island" title="Long Island">
        Long Island
       </a>
       , and the Mid and Lower
       <a href="/wiki/Hudson_Valley" title="Hudson Valley">
        Hudson Valley
       </a>
       in the state of
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_(state)" title="New York (state)">
        New York
       </a>
       ; the five largest cities in
       <a href="/wiki/New_Jersey" title="New Jersey">
        New Jersey
       </a>
       :
       <a href="/wiki/Newark,_New_Jersey" title="Newark, New Jersey">
        Newark
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Jersey_City,_New_Jersey" title="Jersey City, New Jersey">
        Jersey City
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Paterson,_New_Jersey" title="Paterson, New Jersey">
        Paterson
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Elizabeth,_New_Jersey" title="Elizabeth, New Jersey">
        Elizabeth
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Edison,_New_Jersey" title="Edison, New Jersey">
        Edison
       </a>
       , and their vicinities; six of the seven largest cities in
       <a href="/wiki/Connecticut" title="Connecticut">
        Connecticut
       </a>
       :
       <a href="/wiki/Bridgeport,_Connecticut" title="Bridgeport, Connecticut">
        Bridgeport
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/New_Haven,_Connecticut" title="New Haven, Connecticut">
        New Haven
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Stamford,_Connecticut" title="Stamford, Connecticut">
        Stamford
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Waterbury,_Connecticut" title="Waterbury, Connecticut">
        Waterbury
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Norwalk,_Connecticut" title="Norwalk, Connecticut">
        Norwalk
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Danbury,_Connecticut" title="Danbury, Connecticut">
        Danbury
       </a>
       , and their vicinities; and five counties in
       <a href="/wiki/Northeastern_Pennsylvania" title="Northeastern Pennsylvania">
        northeastern Pennsylvania
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       As per the 2015
       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Census_Bureau" title="United States Census Bureau">
        United States Census Bureau
       </a>
       estimates, the New York metropolitan area remains, by a significant margin, the most populous in the United States, as defined by both the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_Metropolitan_Statistical_Areas" title="List of Metropolitan Statistical Areas">
        Metropolitan Statistical Area
       </a>
       (20.2 million residents)
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MetroEst_2-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-MetroEst-2">
         [2]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_Combined_Statistical_Areas" title="List of Combined Statistical Areas">
        Combined Statistical Area
       </a>
       (23.7 million residents);
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CombinedEst_1-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-CombinedEst-1">
         [1]
        </a>
       </sup>
       it is also one of the most populous
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Urban_agglomeration" title="Urban agglomeration">
        urban agglomerations
       </a>
       in the world, and the single largest in
       <a href="/wiki/North_America" title="North America">
        North America
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3">
        <a href="#cite_note-3">
         [3]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4">
        <a href="#cite_note-4">
         [4]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5">
        <a href="#cite_note-5">
         [5]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The New York metropolitan area continues to be the premier gateway for legal
       <a href="/wiki/Immigration_to_the_United_States" title="Immigration to the United States">
        immigration to the United States
       </a>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Immigrants2013est_6-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Immigrants2013est-6">
         [6]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Immigrants2012est_7-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Immigrants2012est-7">
         [7]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Immigrants2011est_8-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Immigrants2011est-8">
         [8]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Immigrants2010est_9-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Immigrants2010est-9">
         [9]
        </a>
       </sup>
       with the largest
       <a href="/wiki/Foreign_born#Metropolitan_regions_with_largest_foreign_born_populations" title="Foreign born">
        foreign-born population of any metropolitan region
       </a>
       in the world. The MSA covers 6,720 sq mi (17,405 km
       <sup>
        2
       </sup>
       ), while the CSA area is 13,318 sq mi (34,493 km
       <sup>
        2
       </sup>
       ), encompassing an ethnically and geographically diverse region. The New York metropolitan area's population is larger than that of the state of New York, and the metropolitan
       <a href="/wiki/Airspace" title="Airspace">
        airspace
       </a>
       accommodated over 130 million passengers in 2016.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYMetroAirspace_10-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-NYMetroAirspace-10">
         [10]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       As a center of many industries, including finance,
       <a href="/wiki/International_trade" title="International trade">
        international trade
       </a>
       , new and traditional media, real estate, education, fashion,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Entertainment_industry" title="Entertainment industry">
        entertainment
       </a>
       , tourism,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Biotech_and_pharmaceutical_companies_in_the_New_York_metropolitan_area" title="Biotech and pharmaceutical companies in the New York metropolitan area">
        biotechnology
       </a>
       , law, and manufacturing, the New York City metropolitan region is one of the most important economic regions in the world; in 2015, the MSA produced a
       <a href="/wiki/Gross_metropolitan_product" title="Gross metropolitan product">
        gross metropolitan product
       </a>
       (GMP) of nearly US$1.60 trillion,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11">
        <a href="#cite_note-11">
         [11]
        </a>
       </sup>
       while in 2015, the CSA
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12">
        <a href="#cite_note-12">
         [12]
        </a>
       </sup>
       had a GMP of over US$1.83 trillion, both ranking first nationally by a wide margin and behind the
       <a href="/wiki/Gross_domestic_product" title="Gross domestic product">
        GDP
       </a>
       of only nine nations and seven nations, respectively.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13">
        <a href="#cite_note-13">
         [13]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In 2012, the New York metropolitan area was also home to
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_highest-income_counties_in_the_United_States" title="List of highest-income counties in the United States">
        seven of the 25 wealthiest counties in the United States
       </a>
       by
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Median_household_income" title="Median household income">
        median household income
       </a>
       , according to the
       <a href="/wiki/American_Community_Survey" title="American Community Survey">
        American Community Survey
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14">
        <a href="#cite_note-14">
         [14]
        </a>
       </sup>
       According to
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">
         Forbes
        </a>
       </i>
       , in 2014, the New York City metropolitan area was home to eight of the top ten
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ZIP_code" title="ZIP code">
        ZIP codes
       </a>
       in the United States by median housing price, with six in
       <a href="/wiki/Manhattan" title="Manhattan">
        Manhattan
       </a>
       alone.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-15">
        <a href="#cite_note-15">
         [15]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The New York metropolitan region's
       <a href="/wiki/Higher_education" title="Higher education">
        higher education network
       </a>
       comprises hundreds of colleges and universities, including
       <a href="/wiki/Columbia_University" title="Columbia University">
        Columbia University
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Princeton_University" title="Princeton University">
        Princeton University
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Yale_University" title="Yale University">
        Yale University
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_University" title="New York University">
        New York University
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Rockefeller_University" title="Rockefeller University">
        Rockefeller University
       </a>
       , all of which have been ranked among the top 40 in the world.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-16">
        <a href="#cite_note-16">
         [16]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-17">
        <a href="#cite_note-17">
         [17]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
      </p>

           <ul>

            </li>

             <a href="#U.S._Routes">

              </span>
              <span class="toctext">
               U.S. Routes
              </span>
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-38">
             <a href="#State_Routes">
              <span class="tocnumber">
               7.2.3
              </span>
              <span class="toctext">
               State Routes
              </span>
             </a>
            </li>
            <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-39">
             <a href="#Other_limited-access_roads">

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Definitions">
        Definitions
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Definitions">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Metropolitan_Statistical_Area">
        Metropolitan Statistical Area
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Metropolitan Statistical Area">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:New_York_City,_Southern_RI_and_CT,_illuminated_at_night.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="480" data-file-width="720" height="167" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/New_York_City%2C_Southern_RI_and_CT%2C_illuminated_at_night.jpg/250px-New_York_City%2C_Southern_RI_and_CT%2C_illuminated_at_night.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/New_York_City%2C_Southern_RI_and_CT%2C_illuminated_at_night.jpg/375px-New_York_City%2C_Southern_RI_and_CT%2C_illuminated_at_night.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/New_York_City%2C_Southern_RI_and_CT%2C_illuminated_at_night.jpg/500px-New_York_City%2C_Southern_RI_and_CT%2C_illuminated_at_night.jpg 2x" width="250"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:New_York_City,_Southern_RI_and_CT,_illuminated_at_night.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a href="/wiki/Satellite_imagery" title="Satellite imagery">
          Satellite imagery
         </a>
         showing the New York metropolitan area at night
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Palisades_cliff.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="750" data-file-width="562" height="294" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Palisades_cliff.jpg/220px-Palisades_cliff.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Palisades_cliff.jpg/330px-Palisades_cliff.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Palisades_cliff.jpg/440px-Palisades_cliff.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Palisades_cliff.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Part of the
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Palisades_Interstate_Park" title="Palisades Interstate Park">
          Palisades Interstate Park
         </a>
         , the cliffs of the
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_Jersey_Palisades" title="New Jersey Palisades">
          New Jersey Palisades
         </a>
         of
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bergen_County" title="Bergen County">
          Bergen County
         </a>
         overlook the
         <a href="/wiki/Hudson_River" title="Hudson River">
          Hudson River
         </a>
         as well as
         <a href="/wiki/The_Bronx" title="The Bronx">
          The Bronx
         </a>
         and
         <a href="/wiki/Upper_Manhattan" title="Upper Manhattan">
          Upper Manhattan
         </a>
         in
         <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">
          New York City
         </a>
         .
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:LI_region_DEM-2.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="490" data-file-width="1023" height="105" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/LI_region_DEM-2.jpg/220px-LI_region_DEM-2.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/LI_region_DEM-2.jpg/330px-LI_region_DEM-2.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/LI_region_DEM-2.jpg/440px-LI_region_DEM-2.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:LI_region_DEM-2.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Enveloped by the
         <a href="/wiki/Atlantic_Ocean" title="Atlantic Ocean">
          Atlantic Ocean
         </a>
         and
         <a href="/wiki/Long_Island_Sound" title="Long Island Sound">
          Long Island Sound
         </a>
         , New York City and
         <a href="/wiki/Long_Island" title="Long Island">
          Long Island
         </a>
         alone are home to approximately 11 million residents conjointly.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Bear_Mtn_Bridge.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="960" data-file-width="1280" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Bear_Mtn_Bridge.jpg/220px-Bear_Mtn_Bridge.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Bear_Mtn_Bridge.jpg/330px-Bear_Mtn_Bridge.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Bear_Mtn_Bridge.jpg/440px-Bear_Mtn_Bridge.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Bear_Mtn_Bridge.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The
         <a href="/wiki/Bear_Mountain_Bridge" title="Bear Mountain Bridge">
          Bear Mountain Bridge
         </a>
         connecting
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Westchester_County" title="Westchester County">
          Westchester
         </a>
         and
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Rockland_County" title="Rockland County">
          Rockland Counties
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/New_York_(state)" title="New York (state)">
          New York
         </a>
         across the Hudson River as seen from
         <a href="/wiki/Bear_Mountain_State_Park" title="Bear Mountain State Park">
          Bear Mountain
         </a>
         .
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The U.S.
       <a href="/wiki/Office_of_Management_and_Budget" title="Office of Management and Budget">
        Office of Management and Budget
       </a>
       utilizes two definitions of the area: the Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) and the Combined Statistical Area (CSA). The MSA definition is titled the
       <i>
        New York-Newark-Jersey City, NY-NJ-PA Metropolitan Statistical Area
       </i>
       , and includes a population of 20.2 million people by 2015 Census estimates, roughly 1 in 16 Americans and nearly 7 million more than the second-place
       <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles_metropolitan_area" title="Los Angeles metropolitan area">
        Los Angeles metropolitan area
       </a>
       in the United States.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MetroEst_2-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-MetroEst-2">
         [2]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The MSA is further subdivided into four metropolitan divisions. The 27-county metropolitan area includes 12 counties in
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_York_State" title="New York State">
        New York State
       </a>
       (coinciding with the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Borough_(New_York_City)" title="Borough (New York City)">
        five boroughs
       </a>
       of New York City, the two counties of
       <a href="/wiki/Long_Island" title="Long Island">
        Long Island
       </a>
       , and five counties in the lower
       <a href="/wiki/Hudson_Valley" title="Hudson Valley">
        Hudson Valley
       </a>
       ); 12 counties in
       <a href="/wiki/North_Jersey" title="North Jersey">
        Northern
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Central_Jersey" title="Central Jersey">
        Central
       </a>
       <a href="/wiki/New_Jersey" title="New Jersey">
        New Jersey
       </a>
       ; and 3 counties in northeastern
       <a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania" title="Pennsylvania">
        Pennsylvania
       </a>
       . The largest
       <a href="/wiki/United_States_urban_area" title="United States urban area">
        urbanized area
       </a>
       in the United States is at the heart of the metropolitan area, the
       <i>
        New York–Newark, NY–NJ–CT Urbanized Area
       </i>
       (estimated to have an area of 6,720 square miles).
      </p>
      <p>
       The counties and county groupings constituting the New York metropolitan area are listed below, with 2012 population estimates:
      </p>
      <p>
       New York–Newark–Jersey City, NY–NJ–PA Metropolitan Statistical Area (19,831,858) (Note: 20,182,305 estimated in 2015
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MetroEst_2-2">
        <a href="#cite_note-MetroEst-2">
         [2]
        </a>
       </sup>
       )
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        New York–Jersey City–White Plains, NY–NJ Metropolitan Division (11,732,233)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">
           Kings County, NY
          </a>
          <i>
           (the borough of Brooklyn in New York City)
          </i>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Queens" title="Queens">
           Queens County, NY
          </a>
          <i>
           (the borough of Queens in New York City)
          </i>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Manhattan" title="Manhattan">
           New York County, NY
          </a>
          <i>
           (the borough of Manhattan in New York City)
          </i>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/The_Bronx" title="The Bronx">
           Bronx County, NY
          </a>
          <i>
           (the borough of The Bronx in New York City)
          </i>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Staten_Island" title="Staten Island">
           Richmond County, NY
          </a>
          <i>
           (the borough of Staten Island in New York City)
          </i>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Westchester_County,_New_York" title="Westchester County, New York">
           Westchester County, NY
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Bergen_County,_New_Jersey" title="Bergen County, New Jersey">
           Bergen County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Hudson_County,_New_Jersey" title="Hudson County, New Jersey">
           Hudson County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Middlesex_County,_New_Jersey" title="Middlesex County, New Jersey">
           Middlesex County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Monmouth_County,_New_Jersey" title="Monmouth County, New Jersey">
           Monmouth County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Ocean_County,_New_Jersey" title="Ocean County, New Jersey">
           Ocean County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Passaic_County,_New_Jersey" title="Passaic County, New Jersey">
           Passaic County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Rockland_County,_New_York" title="Rockland County, New York">
           Rockland County, NY
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Orange_County,_New_York" title="Orange County, New York">
           Orange County, NY
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        Nassau County–Suffolk County, NY Metropolitan Division (2,875,904)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Suffolk_County,_New_York" title="Suffolk County, New York">
           Suffolk County
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Nassau_County,_New_York" title="Nassau County, New York">
           Nassau County
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        Dutchess County-Putnam County, NY Metropolitan Division (397,198)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Putnam_County,_New_York" title="Putnam County, New York">
           Putnam County
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Dutchess_County,_New_York" title="Dutchess County, New York">
           Dutchess County
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Newark,_New_Jersey" title="Newark, New Jersey">
         Newark
        </a>
        , NJ–PA Metropolitan Division (2,126,269)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Essex_County,_New_Jersey" title="Essex County, New Jersey">
           Essex County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Union_County,_New_Jersey" title="Union County, New Jersey">
           Union County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Morris_County,_New_Jersey" title="Morris County, New Jersey">
           Morris County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Somerset_County,_New_Jersey" title="Somerset County, New Jersey">
           Somerset County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Sussex_County,_New_Jersey" title="Sussex County, New Jersey">
           Sussex County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Hunterdon_County,_New_Jersey" title="Hunterdon County, New Jersey">
           Hunterdon County, NJ
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Pike_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Pike County, Pennsylvania">
           Pike County, PA
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Northampton_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Northampton County, Pennsylvania">
           Northampton County, PA
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Lehigh_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Lehigh County, Pennsylvania">
           Lehigh County, PA
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Combined_Statistical_Area">
        Combined Statistical Area
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Combined Statistical Area">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:New_York_Metropolitan_Area_Counties_2013.png">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="860" data-file-width="1015" height="186" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/New_York_Metropolitan_Area_Counties_2013.png/220px-New_York_Metropolitan_Area_Counties_2013.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/New_York_Metropolitan_Area_Counties_2013.png/330px-New_York_Metropolitan_Area_Counties_2013.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/New_York_Metropolitan_Area_Counties_2013.png/440px-New_York_Metropolitan_Area_Counties_2013.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:New_York_Metropolitan_Area_Counties_2013.png" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <b>
          Counties composing the New York–Newark, NY–NJ–CT–PA Combined Statistical Area
         </b>
         <br/>
         <span style="color:#930;">
          New York–Jersey City–White Plains, NY–NJ Metropolitan Division
         </span>
         <br/>
         <span style="color:#c90;">
          Dutchess County–Putnam County, NY Metropolitan Division
         </span>
         <br/>
         <span style="color:#03c;">
          Nassau County–Suffolk County, NY Metropolitan Division
         </span>
         <br/>
         <span style="color:#3c0;">
          Newark, NJ–PA Metropolitan Division
         </span>
         <br/>
         <span style="color:#c6c;">
          Remainder of the New York-Newark, NY–NJ–CT–PA Combined Statistical Area
         </span>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Combined_Statistical_Area" title="Combined Statistical Area">
        Combined Statistical Areas
       </a>
       (CSA) group together adjacent
       <a href="/wiki/Core-based_statistical_area" title="Core-based statistical area">
        core-based statistical areas
       </a>
       with a high degree of economic interconnection.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-18">
        <a href="#cite_note-18">
         [18]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The
       <i>
        New York–Newark, NY–NJ–CT–PA Combined Statistical Area
       </i>
       had an estimated population of 23.7 million as of 2014.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CombinedEst_1-2">
        <a href="#cite_note-CombinedEst-1">
         [1]
        </a>
       </sup>
       About one out of every fifteen Americans resides in this region, which includes ten additional counties in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, and Pennsylvania. This area, less the Pennsylvania portion, is often referred to as the
       <i>
        Tri-State Area
       </i>
       and less commonly the
       <i>
        Tri-state Region
       </i>
       . The New York City television
       <a href="/wiki/Media_market" title="Media market">
        designated market area
       </a>
       (DMA) includes
       <a href="/wiki/Pike_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Pike County, Pennsylvania">
        Pike County, Pennsylvania
       </a>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-19">
        <a href="#cite_note-19">
         [19]
        </a>
       </sup>
       which is also included in the CSA.
      </p>
      <p>
       In addition to the New York–Newark–Jersey City, NY–NJ–PA Metropolitan Statistical Area, the following core-based statistical areas are also included in the New York-Newark, NY-NJ-CT-PA Combined Statistical Area:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Greater_Bridgeport" title="Greater Bridgeport">
         Bridgeport–Stamford–Norwalk, CT
        </a>
        Metropolitan Statistical Area (916,829)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Fairfield_County,_Connecticut" title="Fairfield County, Connecticut">
           Fairfield County
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/New_Haven,_Connecticut" title="New Haven, Connecticut">
         New Haven
        </a>
        –
        <a href="/wiki/Milford,_Connecticut" title="Milford, Connecticut">
         Milford, CT
        </a>
        Metropolitan Statistical Area (862,477)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/New_Haven_County,_Connecticut" title="New Haven County, Connecticut">
           New Haven County, Connecticut
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Allentown,_Pennsylvania" title="Allentown, Pennsylvania">
         Allentown
        </a>
        –
        <a href="/wiki/Bethlehem,_Pennsylvania" title="Bethlehem, Pennsylvania">
         Bethlehem
        </a>
        –
        <a href="/wiki/Easton,_Pennsylvania" title="Easton, Pennsylvania">
         Easton
        </a>
        Metropolitan Statistical Area (821,173)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Warren_County,_New_Jersey" title="Warren County, New Jersey">
           Warren County, New Jersey
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Carbon_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Carbon County, Pennsylvania">
           Carbon County, Pennsylvania
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Lehigh_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Lehigh County, Pennsylvania">
           Lehigh County, Pennsylvania
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Northampton_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Northampton County, Pennsylvania">
           Northampton County, Pennsylvania
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Trenton,_New_Jersey" title="Trenton, New Jersey">
         Trenton, NJ
        </a>
        Metropolitan Statistical Area (366,222)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Mercer_County,_New_Jersey" title="Mercer County, New Jersey">
           Mercer County
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Torrington,_Connecticut" title="Torrington, Connecticut">
         Torrington, CT
        </a>
        Micropolitan Statistical Area (189,927)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Litchfield_County,_Connecticut" title="Litchfield County, Connecticut">
           Litchfield County
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Kingston,_New_York" title="Kingston, New York">
         Kingston, NY
        </a>
        Metropolitan Statistical Area (182,693)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Ulster_County,_New_York" title="Ulster County, New York">
           Ulster County
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/East_Stroudsburg,_Pennsylvania" title="East Stroudsburg, Pennsylvania">
         East Stroudsburg, PA
        </a>
        Metropolitan Statistical Area (169,842)
        <ul>
         <li>
          <a href="/wiki/Monroe_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Monroe County, Pennsylvania">
           Monroe County, Pennsylvania
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Geography">
        Geography
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Geography">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:High_Point_Monument_and_Lake_Marcia_framed.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2119" data-file-width="1626" height="287" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/39/High_Point_Monument_and_Lake_Marcia_framed.jpg/220px-High_Point_Monument_and_Lake_Marcia_framed.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/39/High_Point_Monument_and_Lake_Marcia_framed.jpg/330px-High_Point_Monument_and_Lake_Marcia_framed.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/39/High_Point_Monument_and_Lake_Marcia_framed.jpg/440px-High_Point_Monument_and_Lake_Marcia_framed.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:High_Point_Monument_and_Lake_Marcia_framed.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/High_Point_Monument" title="High Point Monument">
          High Point Monument
         </a>
         as seen from Lake Marcia at High Point,
         <a href="/wiki/Sussex_County,_New_Jersey" title="Sussex County, New Jersey">
          Sussex County
         </a>
         , the highest elevation in New Jersey at 1803 feet above sea level.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-20">
          <a href="#cite_note-20">
           [20]
          </a>
         </sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The area is frequently divided into the following subregions:
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-21">
        <a href="#cite_note-21">
         [21]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22">
        <a href="#cite_note-22">
         [22]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">
         New York City
        </a>
        (Center of the region)
       </li>
       <li>
        Central and eastern
        <a href="/wiki/Long_Island" title="Long Island">
         Long Island
        </a>
        (
        <a href="/wiki/Nassau_County,_New_York" title="Nassau County, New York">
         Nassau County
        </a>
        and
        <a href="/wiki/Suffolk_County,_New_York" title="Suffolk County, New York">
         Suffolk County
        </a>
        counties – separated by water from the rest of the region except New York City; not including
        <a href="/wiki/Queens" title="Queens">
         Queens
        </a>
        County or Kings County (
        <a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">
         Brooklyn
        </a>
        ), which are concurrent with two of New York City's five boroughs)
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/North_Jersey" title="North Jersey">
         North Jersey
        </a>
        (Northern portion of New Jersey)
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Central_Jersey" title="Central Jersey">
         Central Jersey
        </a>
        (Middle portion of New Jersey)
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Hudson_Valley" title="Hudson Valley">
         Hudson Valley
        </a>
        (Lower Hudson Valley suburbs of
        <a href="/wiki/Westchester_County,_New_York" title="Westchester County, New York">
         Westchester County
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Putnam_County,_New_York" title="Putnam County, New York">
         Putnam County
        </a>
        , and
        <a href="/wiki/Rockland_County,_New_York" title="Rockland County, New York">
         Rockland County
        </a>
        Counties; and Mid-Hudson
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Exurb" title="Exurb">
         exurbs
        </a>
        of Dutchess, Sullivan, Orange, and Ulster Counties)
       </li>
       <li>
        Western Connecticut (Only
        <a href="/wiki/Fairfield_County,_Connecticut" title="Fairfield County, Connecticut">
         Fairfield County
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/New_Haven_County,_Connecticut" title="New Haven County, Connecticut">
         New Haven
        </a>
        , and
        <a href="/wiki/Litchfield_County,_Connecticut" title="Litchfield County, Connecticut">
         Litchfield
        </a>
        Counties are part of the region and separated by the state line)
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Lehigh_Valley" title="Lehigh Valley">
         Lehigh Valley
        </a>
        (
        <a href="/wiki/Carbon_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Carbon County, Pennsylvania">
         Carbon County
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Lehigh_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Lehigh County, Pennsylvania">
         Lehigh County
        </a>
        , and
        <a href="/wiki/Northampton_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Northampton County, Pennsylvania">
         Northampton County
        </a>
        counties in Pennsylvania and Warren County in New Jersey)
       </li>
       <li>
        Southern and Eastern
        <a href="/wiki/Pocono_Mountains" title="Pocono Mountains">
         Poconos
        </a>
        (
        <a href="/wiki/Monroe_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Monroe County, Pennsylvania">
         Monroe County
        </a>
        and
        <a href="/wiki/Pike_County,_Pennsylvania" title="Pike County, Pennsylvania">
         Pike County
        </a>
        Counties in Pennsylvania)
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       All eight subregions are often further divided. For instance, Long Island can be divided into its
       <a href="/wiki/South_Shore_(Long_Island)" title="South Shore (Long Island)">
        South
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gold_Coast_(Long_Island)" title="Gold Coast (Long Island)">
        North Shores
       </a>
       (usually when speaking about Nassau County and western Suffolk County) and the East End. The Hudson Valley and Connecticut are sometimes grouped together and referred to as the Northern Suburbs, largely because of the shared usage of the
       <a href="/wiki/Metro-North_Railroad" title="Metro-North Railroad">
        Metro-North Railroad
       </a>
       system.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-23">
        <a href="#cite_note-23">
         [23]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Subregions">
        Subregions
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Subregions">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="New_York_City">
        New York City
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: New York City">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">
        New York City
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       The geographical, cultural, and economic center of the metropolitan area is New York City, which consists of five
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Borough_(New_York_City)" title="Borough (New York City)">
        boroughs
       </a>
       , each of which is also a
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_counties_in_New_York" title="List of counties in New York">
        county of New York State
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-24">
        <a href="#cite_note-24">
         [24]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The five boroughs –
       <a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">
        Brooklyn
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Queens" title="Queens">
        Queens
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Manhattan" title="Manhattan">
        Manhattan
       </a>
       , the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bronx" title="Bronx">
        Bronx
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Staten_Island" title="Staten Island">
        Staten Island
       </a>
       – were consolidated into a single city in 1898.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-25">
        <a href="#cite_note-25">
         [25]
        </a>
       </sup>
       With a Census-estimated
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_City#Demographics" title="New York City">
        population
       </a>
       of 8,550,405 in 2015 (8,491,079 in 2014
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2014NYCest2_26-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-2014NYCest2-26">
         [26]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-census-est-nyc-ny_27-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-census-est-nyc-ny-27">
         [27]
        </a>
       </sup>
       ), distributed over a land area of just 305 square miles (790 km
       <sup>
        2
       </sup>
       ),
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-28">
        <a href="#cite_note-28">
         [28]
        </a>
       </sup>
       New York is the
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population_density" title="List of United States cities by population density">
        most densely populated
       </a>
       major city in the United States.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-density_29-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-density-29">
         [29]
        </a>
       </sup>
       A
       <a href="/wiki/Global_city" title="Global city">
        global power city
       </a>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-30">
        <a href="#cite_note-30">
         [30]
        </a>
       </sup>
       New York City exerts a significant impact upon commerce, finance, media, art, fashion, research, technology, education, and entertainment, its fast pace
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FastPaceNYC1_31-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-FastPaceNYC1-31">
         [31]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-32">
        <a href="#cite_note-32">
         [32]
        </a>
       </sup>
       defining the term
       <i>
        <a class="extiw" href="https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/New_York_minute" title="wikt:New York minute">
         New York minute
        </a>
       </i>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NewYorkMinuteDefinition_33-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-NewYorkMinuteDefinition-33">
         [33]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Home to the
       <a href="/wiki/Headquarters_of_the_United_Nations" title="Headquarters of the United Nations">
        headquarters of the United Nations
       </a>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-34">
        <a href="#cite_note-34">
         [34]
        </a>
       </sup>
       New York is an important center for
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/International_diplomacy" title="International diplomacy">
        international diplomacy
       </a>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-35">
        <a href="#cite_note-35">
         [35]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and has been described as the cultural, financial, and
       <a href="/wiki/Media_(communication)" title="Media (communication)">
        media
       </a>
       capital
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-36">
        <a href="#cite_note-36">
         [36]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-37">
        <a href="#cite_note-37">
         [37]
        </a>
       </sup>
       of the world.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-cultura1_38-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-cultura1-38">
         [38]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-culture2_39-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-culture2-39">
         [39]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-culture3_40-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-culture3-40">
         [40]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-culture4_41-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-culture4-41">
         [41]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-42">
        <a href="#cite_note-42">
         [42]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Long_Island">
        Long Island
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Long Island">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Pineapple_-_Garden_City_NY.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1548" data-file-width="1444" height="236" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ab/Pineapple_-_Garden_City_NY.jpg/220px-Pineapple_-_Garden_City_NY.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ab/Pineapple_-_Garden_City_NY.jpg/330px-Pineapple_-_Garden_City_NY.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ab/Pineapple_-_Garden_City_NY.jpg/440px-Pineapple_-_Garden_City_NY.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Pineapple_-_Garden_City_NY.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The Village of
         <a href="/wiki/Garden_City,_New_York" title="Garden City, New York">
          Garden City
         </a>
         in
         <a href="/wiki/Nassau_County,_New_York" title="Nassau County, New York">
          Nassau County
         </a>
         , Long Island's
         <a href="/wiki/Hempstead,_New_York" title="Hempstead, New York">
          Town of Hempstead
         </a>
         , which with over 770,000 people is the New York metropolitan area's most populous individual
         <a href="/wiki/Municipality" title="Municipality">
          municipality
         </a>
         outside New York City.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HempsteadPopulation_43-0">
          <a href="#cite_note-HempsteadPopulation-43">
           [43]
          </a>
         </sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:WesthamptonInnerWaterway.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2304" data-file-width="3456" height="147" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/WesthamptonInnerWaterway.jpg/220px-WesthamptonInnerWaterway.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/WesthamptonInnerWaterway.jpg/330px-WesthamptonInnerWaterway.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/WesthamptonInnerWaterway.jpg/440px-WesthamptonInnerWaterway.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:WesthamptonInnerWaterway.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a href="/wiki/Westhampton,_New_York" title="Westhampton, New York">
          Westhampton
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Suffolk_County,_New_York" title="Suffolk County, New York">
          Suffolk County, New York
         </a>
         , on the
         <a href="/wiki/East_End_(Long_Island)" title="East End (Long Island)">
          East End
         </a>
         of Long Island.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Long_Island" title="Long Island">
        Long Island
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       Long Island is an
       <a href="/wiki/Island" title="Island">
        island
       </a>
       located just off the northeast coast of the United States and a region wholly within both the U.S. state of New York and the New York City metropolitan area. Stretching east-northeast from
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_Harbor" title="New York Harbor">
        New York Harbor
       </a>
       into the
       <a href="/wiki/Atlantic_Ocean" title="Atlantic Ocean">
        Atlantic Ocean
       </a>
       , the island comprises four
       <a href="/wiki/County_(United_States)" title="County (United States)">
        counties
       </a>
       : Kings and Queens (these form the New York City
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Borough_(New_York_City)" title="Borough (New York City)">
        boroughs
       </a>
       of
       <a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">
        Brooklyn
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Queens" title="Queens">
        Queens
       </a>
       , respectively) to the west; then
       <a href="/wiki/Nassau_County,_New_York" title="Nassau County, New York">
        Nassau
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Suffolk_County,_New_York" title="Suffolk County, New York">
        Suffolk
       </a>
       to the east. However, most people in the New York metropolitan area (even those living in Queens and Brooklyn) colloquially use the term "Long Island" (or "The Island") exclusively to refer to the Nassau-Suffolk county area collectively, which is mainly
       <a href="/wiki/Suburb" title="Suburb">
        suburban
       </a>
       in character.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-44">
        <a href="#cite_note-44">
         [44]
        </a>
       </sup>
       North of the island is
       <a href="/wiki/Long_Island_Sound" title="Long Island Sound">
        Long Island Sound
       </a>
       , across which are the states of
       <a href="/wiki/Connecticut" title="Connecticut">
        Connecticut
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Rhode_Island" title="Rhode Island">
        Rhode Island
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       With a Census-estimated population of 7,838,722 in 2015, constituting nearly 40% of New York State's population,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-census-est-ny_45-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-census-est-ny-45">
         [45]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Kings_County,_New_York_QuickFacts_46-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Kings_County,_New_York_QuickFacts-46">
         [46]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Queens_County,_New_York_QuickFacts_47-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Queens_County,_New_York_QuickFacts-47">
         [47]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Nassau_County,_New_York_QuickFacts_48-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Nassau_County,_New_York_QuickFacts-48">
         [48]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-U.S._Census_Bureau_49-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-U.S._Census_Bureau-49">
         [49]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The majority of New York City residents, 58% as of 2015, now live on Long Island, namely the estimated 4,896,398 residents living in the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Borough_of_New_York_City" title="Borough of New York City">
        New York City boroughs
       </a>
       of
       <a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">
        Brooklyn
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Queens" title="Queens">
        Queens
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LINYCpopulation_50-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-LINYCpopulation-50">
         [50]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Long Island is the
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_islands_by_population" title="List of islands by population">
        most populated
       </a>
       island in any U.S. state or territory, and the 17th-most populous island in the world (ahead of
       <a href="/wiki/Ireland" title="Ireland">
        Ireland
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Jamaica" title="Jamaica">
        Jamaica
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Hokkaido" title="Hokkaido">
        Hokkaidō
       </a>
       ). Its
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_islands_by_population_density" title="List of islands by population density">
        population density
       </a>
       is 5,571 inhabitants per square mile (2,151/km
       <sup>
        2
       </sup>
       ). If Long Island geographically constituted an independent metropolitan statistical area, it would rank
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_Metropolitan_Statistical_Areas" title="List of Metropolitan Statistical Areas">
        fourth most populous
       </a>
       in the United States; while if it were a U.S. state, Long Island would rank
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_U.S._states_by_population" title="List of U.S. states by population">
        13th in population
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_U.S._states_by_population_density" title="List of U.S. states by population density">
        first in population density
       </a>
       . Queens is the most
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ethnic_diversity" title="Ethnic diversity">
        ethnically diverse
       </a>
       urban area in the world.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-51">
        <a href="#cite_note-51">
         [51]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-52">
        <a href="#cite_note-52">
         [52]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Hempstead,_New_York" title="Hempstead, New York">
        Town of Hempstead
       </a>
       in Nassau County, with an estimated population of 770,367 in 2016, is the most populous municipality in the New York metropolitan area outside of New York City.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HempsteadPopulation_43-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-HempsteadPopulation-43">
         [43]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Long Island is the most populated island in the United States and the
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_islands_by_population" title="List of islands by population">
        17th most populous island in the world
       </a>
       . Known especially for recreation, boating and miles of public beaches, including numerous town, county and state parks and
       <a href="/wiki/Fire_Island_National_Seashore" title="Fire Island National Seashore">
        Fire Island National Seashore
       </a>
       . Along the north shore, the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gold_Coast,_Long_Island" title="Gold Coast, Long Island">
        Gold Coast of Long Island
       </a>
       is an upscale section of Nassau and western Suffolk counties that once featured many lavish mansions built and inhabited by wealthy business tycoons in the earlier years of the 20th century, of which only a few remain preserved as historic sites. The
       <a href="/wiki/East_End_(Long_Island)" title="East End (Long Island)">
        East End
       </a>
       of Long Island (known as the "Twin Forks" because of its physical shape) boasts open spaces for farmland and
       <a href="/wiki/Winery" title="Winery">
        wineries
       </a>
       . The South Fork, in particular, comprises numerous towns and villages known collectively as "
       <a href="/wiki/The_Hamptons" title="The Hamptons">
        The Hamptons
       </a>
       " and has an international reputation as a "playground for the rich and famous", with some of the wealthiest communities in the United States. In 2015, according to
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Business_Insider" title="Business Insider">
         Business Insider
        </a>
       </i>
       , the 11962 zip code encompassing
       <a href="/wiki/Sagaponack,_New_York" title="Sagaponack, New York">
        Sagaponack
       </a>
       , within
       <a href="/wiki/Southampton,_New_York" title="Southampton, New York">
        Southampton
       </a>
       , was listed as the most expensive in the U.S. by real estate-listings site Property Shark, with a median home sale price of $5,125,000.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-53">
        <a href="#cite_note-53">
         [53]
        </a>
       </sup>
       During the summer season, many celebrities and the wealthy visit or reside in mansions and waterfront homes, while others spend weekends enjoying the beaches, gardens, bars, restaurants, and nightclubs.
      </p>
      <p>
       Long Island is served by a network of
       <a href="/wiki/Parkway" title="Parkway">
        parkways
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Controlled-access_highway" title="Controlled-access highway">
        expressways
       </a>
       , with the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Long_Island_Expressway" title="Long Island Expressway">
        Long Island Expressway
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Northern_State_Parkway" title="Northern State Parkway">
        Northern State Parkway
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Southern_State_Parkway" title="Southern State Parkway">
        Southern State Parkway
       </a>
       being major east-west routes across significant portions of the island. Passenger rail access is provided by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA)
       <a href="/wiki/Long_Island_Rail_Road" title="Long Island Rail Road">
        Long Island Rail Road
       </a>
       , one of the largest commuter railroads in the United States. Air travel needs are served by several airports. Within Queens, the island is home to
       <a href="/wiki/John_F._Kennedy_International_Airport" title="John F. Kennedy International Airport">
        John F. Kennedy International Airport
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/LaGuardia_Airport" title="LaGuardia Airport">
        LaGuardia Airport
       </a>
       , two of the three major airline hubs serving the New York City area (with Newark Liberty International Airport being the third; all three major airports are operated by The Port Authority of New York &amp; New Jersey).
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Islip_MacArthur_Airport" title="Islip MacArthur Airport">
        Islip MacArthur Airport
       </a>
       (serving commercial airlines) and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Farmingdale/Republic_Airport" title="Farmingdale/Republic Airport">
        Farmingdale/Republic Airport
       </a>
       (private and commuter flights) are both located in Suffolk County.
      </p>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Northern_New_Jersey">
        Northern New Jersey
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: Northern New Jersey">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Bigfalls14w_info.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1420" data-file-width="2286" height="137" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/Bigfalls14w_info.jpg/220px-Bigfalls14w_info.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/Bigfalls14w_info.jpg/330px-Bigfalls14w_info.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/Bigfalls14w_info.jpg/440px-Bigfalls14w_info.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Bigfalls14w_info.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The
         <a href="/wiki/Great_Falls_(Passaic_River)" title="Great Falls (Passaic River)">
          Great Falls
         </a>
         of the
         <a href="/wiki/Passaic_River" title="Passaic River">
          Passaic River
         </a>
         in
         <a href="/wiki/Paterson,_New_Jersey" title="Paterson, New Jersey">
          Paterson
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Passaic_County,_New_Jersey" title="Passaic County, New Jersey">
          Passaic County, New Jersey
         </a>
         , dedicated as a
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Paterson_Great_Falls_National_Historical_Park" title="Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park">
          National Historical Park
         </a>
         in November 2011, incorporates one of the largest
         <a href="/wiki/Waterfall" title="Waterfall">
          waterfalls
         </a>
         in the eastern United States.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-54">
          <a href="#cite_note-54">
           [54]
          </a>
         </sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/North_Jersey" title="North Jersey">
        North Jersey
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       Northern New Jersey, also known colloquially as
       <i>
        North Jersey
       </i>
       , is typically defined as comprising the following counties:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Bergen_County,_New_Jersey" title="Bergen County, New Jersey">
         Bergen County
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Essex_County,_New_Jersey" title="Essex County, New Jersey">
         Essex County
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Hudson_County,_New_Jersey" title="Hudson County, New Jersey">
         Hudson County
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Hunterdon_County,_New_Jersey" title="Hunterdon County, New Jersey">
         Hunterdon County
        </a>
        (anything north of
        <a href="/wiki/Readington_Township,_New_Jersey" title="Readington Township, New Jersey">
         Readington Township
        </a>
        )
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Morris_County,_New_Jersey" title="Morris County, New Jersey">
         Morris County
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Passaic_County,_New_Jersey" title="Passaic County, New Jersey">
         Passaic County
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Somerset_County,_New_Jersey" title="Somerset County, New Jersey">
         Somerset County
        </a>
        (anything north of
        <a href="/wiki/Watchung,_New_Jersey" title="Watchung, New Jersey">
         Watchung
        </a>
        )
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Sussex_County,_New_Jersey" title="Sussex County, New Jersey">
         Sussex County
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Union_County,_New_Jersey" title="Union County, New Jersey">
         Union County
        </a>
        (anything north of
        <a href="/wiki/Westfield,_New_Jersey" title="Westfield, New Jersey">
         Westfield
        </a>
        )
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Warren_County,_New_Jersey" title="Warren County, New Jersey">
         Warren County
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The New Jersey State Department of Tourism splits North Jersey into the urban
       <a href="/wiki/Gateway_Region" title="Gateway Region">
        Gateway Region
       </a>
       and the more rural
       <a href="/wiki/Skylands_Region" title="Skylands Region">
        Skylands Region
       </a>
       . Northern New Jersey is home to four of the largest cities of that state:
       <a href="/wiki/Newark,_New_Jersey" title="Newark, New Jersey">
        Newark
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Jersey_City,_New_Jersey" title="Jersey City, New Jersey">
        Jersey City
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Paterson,_New_Jersey" title="Paterson, New Jersey">
        Paterson
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Elizabeth,_New_Jersey" title="Elizabeth, New Jersey">
        Elizabeth
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       The region is geographically diverse with wetlands, mountains, and valleys throughout the area. It has a large network of
       <a href="/wiki/Limited-access_road" title="Limited-access road">
        expressways
       </a>
       and public transportation rail services, mostly operated by
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_Jersey_Transit" title="New Jersey Transit">
        New Jersey Transit
       </a>
       . Northern New Jersey also contains the second busiest airport in the New York City metropolitan area,
       <a href="/wiki/Newark_Liberty_International_Airport" title="Newark Liberty International Airport">
        Newark Liberty International Airport
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:277px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:2009-08-17_View_of_downtown_Trenton_in_New_Jersey_and_the_mouth_of_the_Assunpink_Creek_from_across_the_Delaware_River_in_Morrisville,_Pennsylvania.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="834" data-file-width="1962" height="117" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/93/2009-08-17_View_of_downtown_Trenton_in_New_Jersey_and_the_mouth_of_the_Assunpink_Creek_from_across_the_Delaware_River_in_Morrisville%2C_Pennsylvania.jpg/275px-2009-08-17_View_of_downtown_Trenton_in_New_Jersey_and_the_mouth_of_the_Assunpink_Creek_from_across_the_Delaware_River_in_Morrisville%2C_Pennsylvania.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/93/2009-08-17_View_of_downtown_Trenton_in_New_Jersey_and_the_mouth_of_the_Assunpink_Creek_from_across_the_Delaware_River_in_Morrisville%2C_Pennsylvania.jpg/413px-2009-08-17_View_of_downtown_Trenton_in_New_Jersey_and_the_mouth_of_the_Assunpink_Creek_from_across_the_Delaware_River_in_Morrisville%2C_Pennsylvania.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/93/2009-08-17_View_of_downtown_Trenton_in_New_Jersey_and_the_mouth_of_the_Assunpink_Creek_from_across_the_Delaware_River_in_Morrisville%2C_Pennsylvania.jpg/550px-2009-08-17_View_of_downtown_Trenton_in_New_Jersey_and_the_mouth_of_the_Assunpink_Creek_from_across_the_Delaware_River_in_Morrisville%2C_Pennsylvania.jpg 2x" width="275"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:2009-08-17_View_of_downtown_Trenton_in_New_Jersey_and_the_mouth_of_the_Assunpink_Creek_from_across_the_Delaware_River_in_Morrisville,_Pennsylvania.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Downtown
         <a href="/wiki/Trenton,_New_Jersey" title="Trenton, New Jersey">
          Trenton
         </a>
         in
         <a href="/wiki/Mercer_County,_New_Jersey" title="Mercer County, New Jersey">
          Mercer County
         </a>
         , including the
         <a href="/wiki/New_Jersey_State_House" title="New Jersey State House">
          New Jersey State House
         </a>
         topped by its golden dome, alongside the
         <a href="/wiki/Delaware_River" title="Delaware River">
          Delaware River
         </a>
         .
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Although it is a suburban region of
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">
        New York City
       </a>
       , much of the
       <a href="/wiki/Gateway_Region" title="Gateway Region">
        Gateway Region
       </a>
       is Highly Urbanized. The entirety of Hudson County, Eastern Essex County, lower Passaic County as well as
       <a href="/wiki/Elizabeth,_New_Jersey" title="Elizabeth, New Jersey">
        Elizabeth
       </a>
       in Union County are all densely populated areas.
      </p>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Central_New_Jersey">
        Central New Jersey
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Central New Jersey">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Central_Jersey" title="Central Jersey">
        Central Jersey
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       <a href="/wiki/Central_Jersey" title="Central Jersey">
        Central Jersey
       </a>
       is the middle portion of the state of New Jersey. Municipalities including
       <a href="/wiki/Trenton,_New_Jersey" title="Trenton, New Jersey">
        Trenton
       </a>
       (the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/State_capital" title="State capital">
        state capital
       </a>
       of New Jersey) and
       <a href="/wiki/Princeton,_New_Jersey" title="Princeton, New Jersey">
        Princeton
       </a>
       (home to
       <a href="/wiki/Princeton_University" title="Princeton University">
        Princeton University
       </a>
       ) are located in this subregion, as is a significant portion of the
       <a href="/wiki/Jersey_Shore" title="Jersey Shore">
        Jersey Shore
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Middlesex_County,_New_Jersey" title="Middlesex County, New Jersey">
         Middlesex County
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Mercer_County,_New_Jersey" title="Mercer County, New Jersey">
         Mercer County
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Monmouth_County,_New_Jersey" title="Monmouth County, New Jersey">
         Monmouth County
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Ocean_County,_New_Jersey" title="Ocean County, New Jersey">
         Ocean County
        </a>
        (some consider this county a part of
        <a href="/wiki/South_Jersey" title="South Jersey">
         South Jersey
        </a>
        )
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Union_County,_New_Jersey" title="Union County, New Jersey">
         Union County
        </a>
        (anything south of
        <a href="/wiki/Westfield,_New_Jersey" title="Westfield, New Jersey">
         Westfield
        </a>
        )
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Somerset_County,_New_Jersey" title="Somerset County, New Jersey">
         Somerset County
        </a>
        (anything south of
        <a href="/wiki/Watchung,_New_Jersey" title="Watchung, New Jersey">
         Watchung
        </a>
        )
       </li>
       <li>
        <a href="/wiki/Hunterdon_County,_New_Jersey" title="Hunterdon County, New Jersey">
         Hunterdon County
        </a>
        (anything south of
        <a href="/wiki/Readington_Township,_New_Jersey" title="Readington Township, New Jersey">
         Readington Township
        </a>
        )
       </li>
      </ul>
      <div class="thumb noresize tnone" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right:auto; overflow:hidden; width:auto; max-width:908px;">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="">
        <div class="overflowbugx" style="overflow:auto;">
         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Belmar-panorama.jpg" title="Belmar, on the Jersey Shore">
          <img alt="" data-file-height="272" data-file-width="1376" height="178" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2e/Belmar-panorama.jpg/900px-Belmar-panorama.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2e/Belmar-panorama.jpg/1350px-Belmar-panorama.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/2e/Belmar-panorama.jpg 2x" width="900"/>
         </a>
        </div>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Belmar-panorama.jpg" title="File:Belmar-panorama.jpg">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a href="/wiki/Belmar,_New_Jersey" title="Belmar, New Jersey">
          Belmar
         </a>
         , on the
         <a href="/wiki/Jersey_Shore" title="Jersey Shore">
          Jersey Shore
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Mohonk_Mountain_House_2011_View_of_Mohonk_Guest_Rooms_from_One_Hiking_Trail_FRD_3205.jpg">
