        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:India_Square_JC_jeh.JPG" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a href="/wiki/India_Square" title="India Square">
          India Square
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/Jersey_City,_New_Jersey" title="Jersey City, New Jersey">
          Jersey City
         </a>
         , New Jersey, known as
         <i>
          Little
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bombay" title="Bombay">
           Bombay
          </a>
         </i>
         ,
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-111">
          <a href="#cite_note-111">
           [107]
          </a>
         </sup>
         home to the highest concentration of
         <a href="/wiki/Indians_in_the_New_York_City_metropolitan_region" title="Indians in the New York City metropolitan region">
          Asian Indians
         </a>
         in the
         <a href="/wiki/Western_Hemisphere" title="Western Hemisphere">
          Western Hemisphere
         </a>
         .
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-112">
          <a href="#cite_note-112">
           [108]
          </a>
         </sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="2010_Census">
        2010 Census
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=21" title="Edit section: 2010 Census">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <table class="wikitable collapsible sortable" style="font-size: 90%;">
       <tr>
        <th>
         Racial composition
        </th>
        <th>
         2010
        </th>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/White_American" title="White American">
          White
         </a>
        </td>
        <td>
         73.4%
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         —Non-Hispanic White
        </td>
        <td>
         51.7%
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <a href="/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_Americans" title="Hispanic and Latino Americans">
          Hispanic or Latino
         </a>
         (of any race)
        </td>
        <td>
         21.7%
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/African_American" title="African American">
          Black or African-American
         </a>
        </td>
        <td>
         15.3%
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Asian_American" title="Asian American">
          Asian
         </a>
        </td>
        <td>
         9%
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Indigenous_Peoples_of_the_Americas" title="Indigenous Peoples of the Americas">
          Native American
         </a>
         or
         <a href="/wiki/Alaska_Natives" title="Alaska Natives">
          Alaskan Native
         </a>
        </td>
        <td>
         0.2%
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         Other
        </td>
        <td>
         0.5%
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         Two or more races
        </td>
        <td>
         1.6%
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <p>
       As of the 2010 Census, the metropolitan area had a population of 22,085,649. The population density was 1,865 per square mile. The racial markup was 51.7%
       <a href="/wiki/White_Americans" title="White Americans">
        White
       </a>
       (non-Latino), 21.7%
       <a href="/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_Americans" title="Hispanic and Latino Americans">
        Latino
       </a>
       , 15.3%
       <a href="/wiki/African_Americans" title="African Americans">
        African-American
       </a>
       , 9.0%
       <a href="/wiki/Asian_Americans" title="Asian Americans">
        Asian-American
       </a>
       , 0.16%
       <a href="/wiki/Native_Americans_in_the_United_States" title="Native Americans in the United States">
        Native American
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Alaskan_Native" title="Alaskan Native">
        Alaskan Native
       </a>
       , 0.03%
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pacific_Islands_American" title="Pacific Islands American">
        Pacific Islands American
       </a>
       , 0.5% Other, and 1.6%
       <a href="/wiki/Multiracial" title="Multiracial">
        Multiracial
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-113">
        <a href="#cite_note-113">
         [109]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The median age was 37.9. 25.5% were under 18, 9.5% were 18 to 24 years, 28% were 25 to 44 years of age, 26.6% were 45 to 64 years old, and 13.2% were over the age of 65. Males composed 48.3% of the population while females were 51.7% of the population.
       <sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        [
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed">
          <span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (June 2012)">
           citation needed
          </span>
         </a>
        </i>
        ]
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       97.7% of the population were in households, 2.3% were in group quarters, and 1% were institutionalized. There were 8,103,731 households of which 30.2% or 2,449,343 had children. 46.1% or 3,736,165 were composed of opposite sex and married couples. Male households with no wife composed 4.9% or 400,534. 15.0% or 1,212,436 were female households, with no husbands. 34% or 2,754,596 were non-family households. The household density was 684 per square mile. 91.9% of housing units were occupied with a 3.8% vacancy rate. The average household size was 2.65 per household. The average income for non-family households was $90,335, and the average income for families was $104,715. 13.3% or 2,888,493 of the population were below the poverty line.
       <sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        [
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed">
          <span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (June 2012)">
           citation needed
          </span>
         </a>
        </i>
        ]
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       26.7% or 5,911,993 of the population were born outside the United States. Out of this, 17.4% or 1,028,506 were born in
       <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">
        Europe
       </a>
       , 27.0% or 1,595,523 were born in
       <a href="/wiki/Asia" title="Asia">
        Asia
       </a>
       , 3.8% or 224,109 were born in
       <a href="/wiki/Africa" title="Africa">
        Africa
       </a>
       , 0.2% or 11,957 were born in
       <a href="/wiki/Oceania" title="Oceania">
        Oceania
       </a>
       , 50.6% or 2,992,639 were born in
       <a href="/wiki/Latin_America" title="Latin America">
        Latin America
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        [
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed">
          <span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (June 2012)">
           citation needed
          </span>
         </a>
        </i>
        ]
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Population_estimates">
        Population estimates
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=22" title="Edit section: Population estimates">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       As of July 1, 2015, the United States Census Bureau estimated the population of the New York City metropolitan area at 23,723,696, an increase of 647,032 from 2010.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CombinedEst_1-3">
        <a href="#cite_note-CombinedEst-1">
         [1]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The New York City metropolitan region is ethnically diverse.
       <a href="/wiki/Asian_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Asian Americans in New York City">
        Asian Americans in New York City
       </a>
       , according to the 2010 Census, number more than one million, greater than the combined totals of
       <a href="/wiki/San_Francisco" title="San Francisco">
        San Francisco
       </a>
       and Los Angeles.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-114">
        <a href="#cite_note-114">
         [110]
        </a>
       </sup>
       New York contains the highest total Asian population of any U.S. city proper.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-115">
        <a href="#cite_note-115">
         [111]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The New York City borough of Queens is home to the state's largest Asian American population and the largest
       <a href="/wiki/Andes" title="Andes">
        Andean
       </a>
       (
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Colombian_American" title="Colombian American">
        Colombian
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ecuadorian_American" title="Ecuadorian American">
        Ecuadorian
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Peruvian_American" title="Peruvian American">
        Peruvian
       </a>
       , and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bolivian_American" title="Bolivian American">
        Bolivian
       </a>
       ) populations in the United States, and is also the most ethnically diverse urban area in the world.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-QueensMostDiverseWorld1_116-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-QueensMostDiverseWorld1-116">
         [112]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-QueensMostDiverseWorld2_117-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-QueensMostDiverseWorld2-117">
         [113]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Han_Chinese" title="Han Chinese">
        Han Chinese
       </a>
       population constitutes the fastest-growing ethnicity in New York State; multiple
       <a href="/wiki/Natural_satellite" title="Natural satellite">
        satellites
       </a>
       of the original
       <a href="/wiki/Chinatown,_Manhattan" title="Chinatown, Manhattan">
        Manhattan Chinatown (紐約華埠)
       </a>
       , in
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinatown,_Brooklyn" title="Chinatown, Brooklyn">
        Brooklyn (布鲁克林華埠)
       </a>
       , and around
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinatown,_Flushing" title="Chinatown, Flushing">
        Flushing, Queens (法拉盛華埠)
       </a>
       , are thriving as traditionally urban enclaves, while also expanding rapidly eastward into suburban
       <a href="/wiki/Nassau_County,_New_York" title="Nassau County, New York">
        Nassau County (拿騷縣)
       </a>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-118">
        <a href="#cite_note-118">
         [114]
        </a>
       </sup>
       on
       <a href="/wiki/Long_Island" title="Long Island">
        Long Island (長島)
       </a>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-119">
        <a href="#cite_note-119">
         [115]
        </a>
       </sup>
       as the New York metropolitan region and New York State have become the top destinations for new Chinese immigrants, respectively, and large-scale
       <a href="/wiki/Chinese_emigration" title="Chinese emigration">
        Chinese immigration
       </a>
       continues into New York City and surrounding areas.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_120-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-autogenerated1-120">
         [116]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Chinese2013est_121-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Chinese2013est-121">
         [117]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-122">
        <a href="#cite_note-122">
         [118]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-123">
        <a href="#cite_note-123">
         [119]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-124">
        <a href="#cite_note-124">
         [120]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-125">
        <a href="#cite_note-125">
         [121]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In 2012, 6.3% of New York City was of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinese_American" title="Chinese American">
        Chinese ethnicity
       </a>
       , with nearly three-fourths living in either Queens or Brooklyn, geographically on Long Island.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-126">
        <a href="#cite_note-126">
         [122]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In particular, the New York area has over 100,000
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Fuzhou_Americans" title="Fuzhou Americans">
        Fuzhounese people
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-127">
        <a href="#cite_note-127">
         [123]
        </a>
       </sup>
       A community numbering 20,000
       <a href="/wiki/Koreans_in_China" title="Koreans in China">
        Korean-Chinese
       </a>
       (
       <i>
        Chaoxianzu
       </i>
       (Chinese: 朝鲜族) or
       <i>
        Joseonjok
       </i>
       (
       <a href="/wiki/Hangul" title="Hangul">
        Hangul
       </a>
       : 조선족)) is centered in
       <a href="/wiki/Flushing,_Queens" title="Flushing, Queens">
        Flushing, Queens
       </a>
       , while New York City is also home to the largest
       <a href="/wiki/Tibetan_people" title="Tibetan people">
        Tibetan
       </a>
       population outside China, India, and
       <a href="/wiki/Nepal" title="Nepal">
        Nepal
       </a>
       , also centered in Queens.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UnreachedNY_128-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-UnreachedNY-128">
         [124]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <a href="/wiki/Korean_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Korean Americans in New York City">
        Koreans
       </a>
       made up 1.2% of the city's population, and
       <a href="/wiki/Japanese_in_New_York_City" title="Japanese in New York City">
        Japanese
       </a>
       0.3%.
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Filipinos_in_the_New_York_City_metropolitan_region" title="Filipinos in the New York City metropolitan region">
        Filipinos
       </a>
       were the largest
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Southeast_Asian" title="Southeast Asian">
        Southeast Asian
       </a>
       ethnic group at 0.8%, followed by
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Vietnamese_American" title="Vietnamese American">
        Vietnamese
       </a>
       , who made up 0.2% of New York City's population in 2010.
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Indian_American" title="Indian American">
        Indians
       </a>
       are the largest
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/South_Asian" title="South Asian">
        South Asian
       </a>
       group, comprising 2.4% of the city's population, with Bangladeshis and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pakistani_American" title="Pakistani American">
        Pakistanis
       </a>
       at 0.7% and 0.5%, respectively.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-129">
        <a href="#cite_note-129">
         [125]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Queens is the preferred borough of settlement for Asian Indians, Koreans, and Filipinos,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-130">
        <a href="#cite_note-130">
         [126]
        </a>
       </sup>
       as well as
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Malaysian_American" title="Malaysian American">
        Malaysians
       </a>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Immigrants2013est_6-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Immigrants2013est-6">
         [6]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and other Southeast Asians;
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-131">
        <a href="#cite_note-131">
         [127]
        </a>
       </sup>
       while Brooklyn is receiving large numbers of both
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/West_Indian_American" title="West Indian American">
        West Indian
       </a>
       as well as Asian Indian immigrants.
      </p>
      <p>
       New York City has the largest
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/European_American" title="European American">
        European
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Non-Hispanic_whites" title="Non-Hispanic whites">
        non-Hispanic white
       </a>
       population of any American city. At 2.7 million in 2012, New York's non-Hispanic white population is larger than the non-Hispanic white populations of Los Angeles (1.1 million), Chicago (865,000), and Houston (550,000) combined.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-132">
        <a href="#cite_note-132">
         [128]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/European_diaspora" title="European diaspora">
        European diaspora
       </a>
       residing in the city is very diverse. According to 2012 Census estimates, there were roughly 560,000
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Italian_American" title="Italian American">
        Italian Americans
       </a>
       , 385,000
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Irish_American" title="Irish American">
        Irish Americans
       </a>
       , 253,000
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/German_American" title="German American">
        German Americans
       </a>
       , 223,000
       <a href="/wiki/Russian_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Russian Americans in New York City">
        Russian Americans
       </a>
       , 201,000
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Polish_American" title="Polish American">
        Polish Americans
       </a>
       , and 137,000
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/English_American" title="English American">
        English Americans
       </a>
       . Additionally,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Greek_American" title="Greek American">
        Greek
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/French_American" title="French American">
        French Americans
       </a>
       numbered 65,000 each, with those of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hungarian_American" title="Hungarian American">
        Hungarian
       </a>
       descent estimated at 60,000 people.
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ukrainian_American" title="Ukrainian American">
        Ukrainian
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Scottish_American" title="Scottish American">
        Scottish Americans
       </a>
       numbered 55,000 and 35,000, respectively. People identifying ancestry from
       <a href="/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">
        Spain
       </a>
       numbered 30,838 total in 2010.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HispanicLatino_133-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-HispanicLatino-133">
         [129]
        </a>
       </sup>
       People of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Norwegian_American" title="Norwegian American">
        Norwegian
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Swedish_American" title="Swedish American">
        Swedish
       </a>
       descent both stood at about 20,000 each, while people of
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Czech_American" title="Czech American">
        Czech
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lithuanian_American" title="Lithuanian American">
        Lithuanian
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Portuguese_American" title="Portuguese American">
        Portuguese
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Scotch-Irish_American" title="Scotch-Irish American">
        Scotch-Irish
       </a>
       , and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Welsh_American" title="Welsh American">
        Welsh
       </a>
       descent all numbered between 12,000–14,000 people.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-134">
        <a href="#cite_note-134">
         [130]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Arab_American" title="Arab American">
        Arab Americans
       </a>
       number over 160,000 in New York City,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-135">
        <a href="#cite_note-135">
         [131]
        </a>
       </sup>
       with the highest concentration in Brooklyn.
       <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Central_Asia" title="Demographics of Central Asia">
        Central Asians
       </a>
       , primarily
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Uzbek_American" title="Uzbek American">
        Uzbek Americans
       </a>
       , are a rapidly growing segment of the city's non-Hispanic white population, enumerating over 30,000, and including over half of all Central Asian immigrants to the United States,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-136">
        <a href="#cite_note-136">
         [132]
        </a>
       </sup>
       most settling in Queens or Brooklyn.
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Albanian_American" title="Albanian American">
        Albanian Americans
       </a>
       are most highly concentrated in the Bronx.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-137">
        <a href="#cite_note-137">
         [133]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:New_York_Gay_Pride_2011.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="683" data-file-width="1024" height="167" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/New_York_Gay_Pride_2011.jpg/250px-New_York_Gay_Pride_2011.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/New_York_Gay_Pride_2011.jpg/375px-New_York_Gay_Pride_2011.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/New_York_Gay_Pride_2011.jpg/500px-New_York_Gay_Pride_2011.jpg 2x" width="250"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:New_York_Gay_Pride_2011.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The New York City metropolitan area is home to the
         <a href="/wiki/LGBT_demographics_of_the_United_States#By_city" title="LGBT demographics of the United States">
          largest gay and bisexual community
         </a>
         in the United States and one of the world's largest.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GLB_138-0">
          <a href="#cite_note-GLB-138">
           [134]
          </a>
         </sup>
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-WorldLargestGLBT_139-0">
          <a href="#cite_note-WorldLargestGLBT-139">
           [135]
          </a>
         </sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The wider New York City metropolitan area is also
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ethnic_diversity" title="Ethnic diversity">
        ethnically diverse
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-140">
        <a href="#cite_note-140">
         [136]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The New York region continues to be by far the leading metropolitan gateway for legal immigrants admitted into the United States, substantially exceeding the combined totals of Los Angeles and
       <a href="/wiki/Miami_metropolitan_area" title="Miami metropolitan area">
        Miami
       </a>
       , the next most popular gateway regions.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-141">
        <a href="#cite_note-141">
         [137]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-142">
        <a href="#cite_note-142">
         [138]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-143">
        <a href="#cite_note-143">
         [139]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-144">
        <a href="#cite_note-144">
         [140]
        </a>
       </sup>
       It is home to the largest
       <a href="/wiki/Jews_in_New_York_City" title="Jews in New York City">
        Jewish
       </a>
       as well as
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Israeli_American" title="Israeli American">
        Israeli
       </a>
       communities outside
       <a href="/wiki/Israel" title="Israel">
        Israel
       </a>
       , with the Jewish population in the region numbering over 1.5 million in 2012 and including many diverse Jewish sects from around the
       <a href="/wiki/Middle_East" title="Middle East">
        Middle East
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Europe" title="Eastern Europe">
        Eastern Europe
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UnreachedNY_128-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-UnreachedNY-128">
         [124]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The metropolitan area is also home to 20% of the nation's
       <a href="/wiki/Indians_in_the_New_York_City_metropolitan_region" title="Indians in the New York City metropolitan region">
        Indian Americans
       </a>
       and at least 20
       <a href="/wiki/Little_India_(location)" title="Little India (location)">
        Little India
       </a>
       enclaves, as well as 15% of all
       <a href="/wiki/Korean_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Korean Americans in New York City">
        Korean Americans
       </a>
       and four
       <a href="/wiki/Koreatown,_Manhattan" title="Koreatown, Manhattan">
        Koreatowns
       </a>
       ;
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-factfinder2.census_145-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-factfinder2.census-145">
         [141]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-146">
        <a href="#cite_note-146">
         [142]
        </a>
       </sup>
       the largest
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Asian_Indian" title="Asian Indian">
        Asian Indian
       </a>
       population in the Western Hemisphere; the largest Russian American,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_120-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-autogenerated1-120">
         [116]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Italian_American" title="Italian American">
        Italian American
       </a>
       , and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/African_American" title="African American">
        African American
       </a>
       populations; the largest
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dominican_American" title="Dominican American">
        Dominican American
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Puerto_Rican_migration_to_New_York_City" title="Puerto Rican migration to New York City">
        Puerto Rican American
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/South_America" title="South America">
        South American
       </a>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_120-2">
        <a href="#cite_note-autogenerated1-120">
         [116]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and second-largest overall
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_American" title="Hispanic and Latino American">
        Hispanic
       </a>
       population in the United States, numbering 4.8 million;
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HispanicLatino_133-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-HispanicLatino-133">
         [129]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and includes at least 6 established
       <a href="/wiki/Chinatown" title="Chinatown">
        Chinatowns
       </a>
       within New York City alone,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-147">
        <a href="#cite_note-147">
         [143]
        </a>
       </sup>
       with the urban agglomeration comprising a population of 819,527 uniracial
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinese_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Chinese Americans in New York City">
        overseas Chinese
       </a>
       as of 2014 Census estimates,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-148">
        <a href="#cite_note-148">
         [144]
        </a>
       </sup>
       the largest outside of
       <a href="/wiki/Asia" title="Asia">
        Asia
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCLargestChinesePopulation_107-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-NYCLargestChinesePopulation-107">
         [103]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-queensbuzz_108-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-queensbuzz-108">
         [104]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Ecuador,
       <a href="/wiki/Colombia" title="Colombia">
        Colombia
       </a>
       , Guyana,
       <a href="/wiki/Peru" title="Peru">
        Peru
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">
        Brazil
       </a>
       were the top source countries from South America for legal immigrants to the New York City region in 2013; the Dominican Republic,
       <a href="/wiki/Jamaica" title="Jamaica">
        Jamaica
       </a>
       , Haiti, and Trinidad and Tobago in the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Caribbeans_in_New_York_City" title="Caribbeans in New York City">
        Caribbean
       </a>
       ;
       <a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">
        Egypt
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Ghana" title="Ghana">
        Ghana
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Nigeria" title="Nigeria">
        Nigeria
       </a>
       from
       <a href="/wiki/Africa" title="Africa">
        Africa
       </a>
       ; and
       <a href="/wiki/El_Salvador" title="El Salvador">
        El Salvador
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Honduras" title="Honduras">
        Honduras
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Guatemala" title="Guatemala">
        Guatemala
       </a>
       in
       <a href="/wiki/Central_America" title="Central America">
        Central America
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-149">
        <a href="#cite_note-149">
         [145]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Amidst a resurgence of
       <a href="/wiki/Puerto_Rican_migration_to_New_York_City" title="Puerto Rican migration to New York City">
        Puerto Rican migration to New York City
       </a>
       , this population had increased to approximately 1.3 million in the metropolitan area as of 2013.
      </p>
      <p>
       The New York metropolitan area is home to a self-identifying
       <a href="/wiki/Gay" title="Gay">
        gay
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Bisexuality" title="Bisexuality">
        bisexual
       </a>
       community estimated at 568,903 individuals, the largest in the United States and one of the world's largest.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-GLB_138-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-GLB-138">
         [134]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-WorldLargestGLBT_139-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-WorldLargestGLBT-139">
         [135]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <a href="/wiki/Same-sex_marriage_in_New_York" title="Same-sex marriage in New York">
        Same-sex marriages in New York
       </a>
       were legalized on June 24, 2011 and were authorized to take place beginning 30 days thereafter.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-150">
        <a href="#cite_note-150">
         [146]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The annual
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_York_City_Pride_March" title="New York City Pride March">
        New York City Pride March
       </a>
       (or
       <a href="/wiki/New_York_City_LGBT_Pride_March" title="New York City LGBT Pride March">
        gay
       </a>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pride_march" title="Pride march">
        pride parade
       </a>
       ) traverses southward down
       <a href="/wiki/Fifth_Avenue" title="Fifth Avenue">
        Fifth Avenue
       </a>
       in Manhattan, ending at
       <a href="/wiki/Greenwich_Village" title="Greenwich Village">
        Greenwich Village
       </a>
       , and rivals the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sao_Paulo_Gay_Pride_Parade" title="Sao Paulo Gay Pride Parade">
        Sao Paulo Gay Pride Parade
       </a>
       as the largest pride parade in the world, attracting tens of thousands of participants and millions of sidewalk spectators each June.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCWorld'sLargestPrideParade_151-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-NYCWorld'sLargestPrideParade-151">
         [147]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Religion">
        Religion
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=New_York_metropolitan_area&amp;action=edit&amp;section=23" title="Edit section: Religion">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tmulti tnone center">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:1052px;max-width:1052px">
        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:104px;max-width:104px">
         <div class="thumbimage">
          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:StPatCathExt1.jpg">
           <img alt="" data-file-height="650" data-file-width="443" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/StPatCathExt1.jpg/102px-StPatCathExt1.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/StPatCathExt1.jpg/153px-StPatCathExt1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/StPatCathExt1.jpg/204px-StPatCathExt1.jpg 2x" width="102"/>
          </a>
         </div>
         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left">
          The
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_York_City_Landmarks" title="New York City Landmarks">
           landmark
          </a>
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gothic_revival_architecture" title="Gothic revival architecture">
           Neo-Gothic
          </a>
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Roman_Catholic" title="Roman Catholic">
           Roman Catholic
          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/St._Patrick%27s_Cathedral_(Manhattan)" title="St. Patrick's Cathedral (Manhattan)">
           St. Patrick's Cathedral
          </a>
          , Midtown Manhattan.
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:202px;max-width:202px">
         <div class="thumbimage">
          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg">
           <img alt="" data-file-height="768" data-file-width="1024" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg/200px-Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg/300px-Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg/400px-Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg 2x" width="200"/>
          </a>
         </div>
         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left">
          Brooklyn's rapidly growing
          <a href="/wiki/Orthodox_Judaism#In_the_United_States" title="Orthodox Judaism">
           Orthodox
          </a>
          <a href="/wiki/Jews_in_New_York_City" title="Jews in New York City">
           Jewish (יהודי)
          </a>
          community is the largest in the United States, with approximately 600,000 individuals.
          <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-152">
           <a href="#cite_note-152">
            [148]
           </a>
          </sup>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:133px;max-width:133px">
         <div class="thumbimage">
          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG">
           <img alt="" data-file-height="2388" data-file-width="2073" height="151" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG/131px-Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG/197px-Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG/262px-Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG 2x" width="131"/>
          </a>
         </div>
         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left">
          The
          <a href="/wiki/Islamic_Cultural_Center_of_New_York" title="Islamic Cultural Center of New York">
           Islamic Cultural Center of New York
          </a>
          (
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Arabic_language" title="Arabic language">
           Arabic:المركز الثقافي الإسلامي في نيويورك
          </a>
          ) in
          <a href="/wiki/Upper_Manhattan" title="Upper Manhattan">
           Upper Manhattan
          </a>
          .
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:197px;max-width:197px">
         <div class="thumbimage">
          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Temple_at_Flushing,_NY.jpg">
           <img alt="" data-file-height="1233" data-file-width="1600" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bd/Temple_at_Flushing%2C_NY.jpg/195px-Temple_at_Flushing%2C_NY.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bd/Temple_at_Flushing%2C_NY.jpg/293px-Temple_at_Flushing%2C_NY.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bd/Temple_at_Flushing%2C_NY.jpg/390px-Temple_at_Flushing%2C_NY.jpg 2x" width="195"/>
          </a>
         </div>
         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left">
          <a href="/wiki/Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America" title="Hindu Temple Society of North America">
           Sri Maha Vallabha
          </a>
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ganapati" title="Ganapati">
           Ganapati
          </a>
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Devasthanam" title="Devasthanam">
           Devasthanam
          </a>
          (
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tamil_American" title="Tamil American">
           Tamil: ஸ்ரீ மகா வல்லப கணபதி தேவஸ்தானம்
          </a>
          ), in
          <a href="/wiki/Flushing,_Queens" title="Flushing, Queens">
           Flushing
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="/wiki/Queens" title="Queens">
           Queens
          </a>
          , the oldest
          <a href="/wiki/Hinduism" title="Hinduism">
           Hindu
          </a>
          temple in the United States.
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:202px;max-width:202px">
         <div class="thumbimage">
          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Chuang_Yen_Monastery_2004.jpeg">
           <img alt="" data-file-height="1944" data-file-width="2592" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Chuang_Yen_Monastery_2004.jpeg/200px-Chuang_Yen_Monastery_2004.jpeg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Chuang_Yen_Monastery_2004.jpeg/300px-Chuang_Yen_Monastery_2004.jpeg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Chuang_Yen_Monastery_2004.jpeg/400px-Chuang_Yen_Monastery_2004.jpeg 2x" width="200"/>
          </a>
         </div>
         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left">
          The
          <a href="/wiki/Chuang_Yen_Monastery" title="Chuang Yen Monastery">
           Chuang Yen Monastery (莊嚴寺)
          </a>
          , in
          <a href="/wiki/Kent,_New_York" title="Kent, New York">
           Kent
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="/wiki/Putnam_County,_New_York" title="Putnam County, New York">
           Putnam County
          </a>
          , houses the largest indoor statue of
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Buddha" title="Buddha">
           Buddha
          </a>
          in the
          <a href="/wiki/Western_Hemisphere" title="Western Hemisphere">
           Western Hemisphere
          </a>
          .
          <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-153">
           <a href="#cite_note-153">
            [149]
           </a>
          </sup>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:202px;max-width:202px">
         <div class="thumbimage">
          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Times_Square_after_dark_atheist.jpg">
           <img alt="" data-file-height="3456" data-file-width="4608" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Times_Square_after_dark_atheist.jpg/200px-Times_Square_after_dark_atheist.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Times_Square_after_dark_atheist.jpg/300px-Times_Square_after_dark_atheist.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Times_Square_after_dark_atheist.jpg/400px-Times_Square_after_dark_atheist.jpg 2x" width="200"/>
          </a>
         </div>
         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left">
          <a href="/wiki/Atheism" title="Atheism">
           Atheism
          </a>
          , promoted on an
          <a href="/wiki/Digital_billboard" title="Digital billboard">
           electronic billboard
          </a>
          in
          <a href="/wiki/Times_Square" title="Times Square">
           Times Square
          </a>
          , is observed by a significant proportion of New Yorkers.
         </div>
        </div>
        <div style="clear:left">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

       <a href="/wiki/Pew_Research_Center" title="Pew Research Center">

       </a>

      </p>
